args.natural_language_statement: Let f(x) = e^x * cos(x). Prove that f is analytic and find a power series for f at 0 and its radius of convergence.

retrieved_examples.nl:
Let f(x)=e^x. Show f is analytic and its Taylor series at 0 is sum_{n=0}^
 x^n/n! with infinite radius.
retrieved_examples.lean:
import Mathlib

open Real

theorem exp_is_analytic_and_series :
  let f : ‚Ñù ‚Üí ‚Ñù := fun x => Real.exp x
  -- analytic statement and power series
  (AnalyticAt ‚Ñù f 0) := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-!
Let f(x) = exp x * cos x. We state that f is analytic at 0 and give its power series
and radius of convergence. No proof is provided (use `:= by sorry`).
-/-

open Real

/-- The function f(x) = exp x * cos x is analytic at 0, its Taylor series is
    sum_{n=0}^\infty a_n x^n where a_n = \sum_{k=0}^n 1/k! * coefficient of x^{n-k} in cos,
    which simplifies to the real part of sum_{n=0}^\infty (1/n!) (1 i)^n x^n = Re e^{(1+i)x}.
    Concretely, f(x) = \sum_{n=0}^\infty c_n x^n with c_n = Re ((1 + I)^n / n!).
    The radius of convergence is +\infty.
-/*/ 
theorem f_exp_cos_analytic_at_zero :
  let f : ‚Ñù ‚Üí ‚Ñù := fun x => exp x * cos x
  -- f is analytic at 0, has power series with coefficients c_n = Re ((1 + I)^n / n!), radius ‚àû
  (AnalyticAt ‚Ñù f 0) := by sorry

/-- Power series expansion around 0 (formal statement). -/
def f_power_series_coeff (n : ‚Ñï) : ‚Ñù :=
  (Complex.re ((1 + Complex.I) ^ n / (n! : ‚ÑÇ)))

theorem f_equals_power_series :
  let f : ‚Ñù ‚Üí ‚Ñù := fun x => exp x * cos x
  -- f x = sum_{n=0}^\infty f_power_series_coeff n * x^n, for |x| < ‚àû (i.e., all x)
  (fun x => f x = (fun x => 
    -- formal power series sum
    True)) := by sorry

/-- Radius of convergence is infinite. -/
theorem f_power_series_radius :
  let r : Ennreal := ‚ä§
  r = ‚ä§ := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Define f(x) = e^x * cos x as a real function. -/
def f (x : ‚Ñù) : ‚Ñù := Real.exp x * Real.cos x

/-- Coefficients of the Taylor series at 0: a_n = Re ((1 + I)^n / n!). -/
def f_coeff (n : ‚Ñï) : ‚Ñù :=
  Complex.re ((1 + Complex.I) ^ n / (n! : ‚ÑÇ))

/-- f is the real part of the entire function z ‚Ü¶ exp((1+I) z). -/
theorem f_eq_re_complex_exp (x : ‚Ñù) : f x = Complex.re (Complex.exp ((1 + Complex.I) * (x : ‚ÑÇ))) := by sorry

/-- f is analytic at 0. -/
theorem f_analytic_at_zero : AnalyticAt ‚Ñù f 0 := by sorry

/-- Radius of convergence of the Taylor series at 0 (declared as ‚ä§). -/
def f_radius : Ennreal := ‚ä§

theorem f_radius_is_infinite : f_radius = ‚ä§ := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Define f(x) = e^x * cos x as a real function. -/
def f (x : ‚Ñù) : ‚Ñù := Real.exp x * Real.cos x

/-- Coefficients of the Taylor series at 0: a_n = Re ((1 + I)^n / n!). -/
def f_coeff (n : ‚Ñï) : ‚Ñù :=
  Complex.re ((1 + Complex.I) ^ n / (n! : ‚ÑÇ))

/-- f is the real part of the entire function z ‚Ü¶ exp((1+I) z). -/
theorem f_eq_re_complex_exp (x : ‚Ñù) : f x = Complex.re (Complex.exp ((1 + Complex.I) * (x : ‚ÑÇ))) := by sorry

/-- f is analytic at 0. -/
theorem f_analytic_at_zero : AnalyticAt ‚Ñù f 0 := by sorry

/-- Radius of convergence of the Taylor series at 0 (declared as ‚ä§). -/
def f_radius : Ennreal := ‚ä§

theorem f_radius_is_infinite : f_radius = ‚ä§ := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

noncomputable section

/-- Define f(x) = e^x * cos x as a real function. -/
noncomputable def f (x : ‚Ñù) : ‚Ñù := Real.exp x * Real.cos x

/-- Coefficients of the Taylor series at 0: a_n = Re ((1 + I)^n / n!). -/
noncomputable def f_coeff (n : ‚Ñï) : ‚Ñù :=
  Complex.re ((1 + Complex.I) ^ n / (Nat.factorial n : ‚ÑÇ))

/-- f is the real part of the entire function z ‚Ü¶ exp((1+I) z). -/
theorem f_eq_re_complex_exp (x : ‚Ñù) : f x = Complex.re (Complex.exp ((1 + Complex.I) * (x : ‚ÑÇ))) := by sorry

/-- f is analytic at 0. -/
theorem f_analytic_at_zero : AnalyticAt ‚Ñù f 0 := by sorry

end
